abstract: Real estate companies led by Simon Halabi have defaulted on 1.15 billion pounds ($1.9 billion) of bonds backed by nine London office buildings, including some occupied by JPMorgan Chase.
snippet: Real estate companies led by Simon Halabi have defaulted on 1.15 billion pounds ($1.9 billion) of bonds backed by nine London office buildings, including some occupied by JPMorgan Chase.
lead_paragraph: Companies run by one of Britain’s largest property magnates have defaulted on 1.15 billion pounds ($1.9 billion) in debt as the commercial property crash in London’s city center takes its toll on real estate investors.

headline.main: Falling Prices Squeeze Real Estate Mogul in Britain

abstract: JPMorgan Chase disclosed that it expected to record a $1.1 billion charge in its second-quarter results after returning $25 billion in taxpayer funds to the government.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase disclosed that it expected to record a $1.1 billion charge in its second-quarter results after returning $25 billion in taxpayer funds to the government.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase disclosed Friday that it expected to record a $1.1 billion charge in its second-quarter results after returning $25 billion in taxpayer funds to the federal government.

headline.main: JPMorgan Sees $1.1 Billion Charge Tied to TARP
